commits.author: Paul Chaignon
commits.summary: Avoid using the ambiguous \h shorthand character (#127)
commits.body:
Depending on the regular expression engine used, \h does not always
mean the same. With a PCRE engine, it matches white spaces, whereas,
with a Oniguruma engine, it matches hexademical digit characters.
Atom uses an Oniguruma engine, but github.com relies on a PCRE
engine.

commits.author: Andrew Shu
commits.summary: Fix highlighting for function with header
commits.body:
Assume that def/defp closes the previous
def/defp group which corresponds to the
function header.

Uses regex lookahead to prevent the parser from
consuming the def/defp and breaking
highlighting of the following function.

commits.author: Bryan Enders
commits.body:
Selector `comment.line.section.elixir` matches line comments that are
conventionally used to demarcate sections, in the form:

```elixir
  ## Callbacks
```

Only matches if the comment is at the start of the line or preceeded by
whitespace. This would not match:
```elixir
42 ## The ultimate answer to life, the universe, and everything
```
